description: The `createDiscountRule()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the new discount rule when it's created.

params.name: discountRuleId
params.doc: ID of the discount rule to delete.

description: The `deleteDiscountRule()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified discount rule is deleted.

params.name: discountRuleId
params.doc: ID of the discount rule to retrieve.

description: The `getDiscountRule()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified discount rule is retrieved.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of discount rules.
description: The queryDiscountRules() function builds a query to retrieve a list of up to 100 discount rules, and returns a [`DiscountRulesQueryBuilder`](#discountrulesquerybuilder) object.

The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-ecom-backend/discounts/discountrulesquerybuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `DiscountRulesQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `DiscountRulesQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results queryDiscountRules() returns.

By default, `queryDiscountRules()` sorts results by [`ascending("_id")`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-ecom-backend/discounts/discountrulesquerybuilder/ascending) by default. This can be overridden.
To learn how to query posts, refer to the table below.

The following `DiscountRulesQueryBuilder` functions are supported for the `queryDiscountRules()` function. For a full description of the discount rule object, see the object returned for the [`items`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-ecom-backend/discounts/discountrulesqueryresult/items) property in [`DiscountRulesQueryResult`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-ecom-backend/discounts/discountrulesqueryresult).
|PROPERTY	|SUPPORTED FILTERS & SORTING

|`_id`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`startsWith()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#startsWith),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`revision`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`gt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ge),[`lt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#le),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`_createdDate`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`gt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ge),[`lt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#le),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`_updatedDate`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`gt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ge),[`lt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#le),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`active`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`name`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`startsWith()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#startsWith),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`activeTimeInfo.start`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`gt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ge),[`lt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#le),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`activeTimeInfo.end`|[`eq()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#in),[`gt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ge),[`lt()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#le),[`exists()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-ecom-backend.DiscountRules.DiscountRulesQueryBuilder#descending)|

The `updateDiscountRule()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified discount rule's properties are updated.

Each time the discount rule is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The existing `revision` must be included when updating the discount rule. This ensures you're working with the latest discount rule information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.

examples.title: updateDiscountRule example
body: const result = await discountRules.updateDiscountRule(id, discountRule, options);

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule is active **till**, in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule is active **from**, in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Combined_date_and_time_representations) format.

members.name: triggers
members.doc:
List of triggers.
Max: 5 triggers.

members.name: appliedDiscountRule
members.doc: Applied discount rule.

members.name: discountType
members.doc: Discount type.

members.name: lineItemIds
members.doc: IDs of line items the discount applies to, in GUID format.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Applied discount rule ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Total amount reduced from all discounted line items.

members.name: discountRuleType
members.doc: Discount rule type.

members.name: name
members.doc: Discount rule name.

members.name: customerBuys
members.doc: Information about which items must be in the cart (buy X) for the discount to apply (get Y).

members.name: customerGets
members.doc: Information about which items will be discounted (get Y).

members.name: limit
members.doc:
The maximum number of times the 'buy X get Y' discount can be applied.
For example, when the value of `limit` is `2`, with a "2+1" sale on all items, the following logic applies:
+ Buy 2 get 1, buy 3 get 1.
+ Buy 4 get 2, buy 6 get 2, buy 9 get 2, and so on.

members.name: catalogAppId
members.doc: Catalog App ID. For example, the Wix Stores, Wix Bookings, or 3rd-party `appId`.

members.name: catalogItemIds
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app providing the catalog. For items from Wix apps, the following values always apply:
+ Wix Stores: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`
+ Wix Bookings: `"13d21c63-b5ec-5912-8397-c3a5ddb27a97"`

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores or `bookingId` for Wix Bookings.

members.name: options
members.doc:
Additional info in key:value pairs. For example, to specify Wix Stores product options or variants:
+ `{"options": {"options": {"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}}}`
+ `{"options": {"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}}`

description: Used for grouping line items and is sent on add to cart

members.name: discountRule
members.doc: Discount rule info.

members.name: discountRule
members.doc: Discount rule.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Trigger ID.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the app that created the trigger.

members.name: appId
members.doc: Custom filter app ID, when relevant.

members.name: params
members.doc:
Custom filter in `{ "key": "value" }` form.
For example, an array of `collectionIDs`:
`{ ["collectionId": "12345"], ["collectionId": "67890"] }`.

members.name: minimumQuantity
members.doc: Minimum number of items the customer must add to the cart to be eligible for a discount.

members.name: minimumSpend
members.doc: Minimum price the customer must add to the cart to be eligible for a discount.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: Scopes of the items that must be added to the cart to enable the discount.

members.name: minimumQuantity
members.doc: Minimum number of items the customer must add to the cart to be eligible for a discount.

members.name: minimumSpend
members.doc: Minimum price the customer must add to the cart to be eligible for a discount.

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Exact number of items in the cart that will be discounted.
If the cart contains fewer items than the value of quantity, the discount will not apply.

members.name: scopes
members.doc: Scopes of the items that will be discounted.

members.name: discountRuleId
members.doc: ID of the discount rule to delete.

members.name: discountType
members.doc:
Discount type.

+ `"PERCENTAGE"`: Price is reduced by percentage value.
+ `"FIXED_AMOUNT"`: Price is reduced by fixed amount.
+ `"FIXED_PRICE"`: Price will be set to fixed amount.

members.name: fixedAmount
members.doc: Amount to discount from original price.

members.name: fixedPrice
members.doc: Fixed price. Line item will be fixed to this price.

members.name: percentage
members.doc: Percentage to discount from original price.

members.name: specificItemsInfo
members.doc: Data related to `"SPECIFIC_ITEMS"` target type.

members.name: targetType
members.doc:
Discount target.

+ `"SPECIFIC_ITEMS"`: Discount applies to a specific set of items.

members.name: fixedAmount
members.doc: Amount to discount from original price.

members.name: fixedPrice
members.doc: Fixed price. Line item will be fixed to this price.

members.name: percentage
members.doc: Percentage to discount from original price.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Discount rule ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the discount rule was last updated.

members.name: active
members.doc:
Whether the discount rule is active.

Default: `true`

members.name: activeTimeInfo
members.doc: Time frame in which the discount rule is active.

members.name: discounts
members.doc:
List of discounts that are applied when one or more triggers are met.

Currently, a discount rule can apply only 1 discount.

members.name: name
members.doc: Discount rule name.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the discount rule is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the discount rule.

members.name: status
members.doc: Discount rule status.

members.name: trigger
members.doc:
Discount rule trigger.
A set of conditions that must be met for the `discounts` to be applied.
Not passing a trigger will cause the discount to always apply.

members.name: usageCount
members.doc: Number of times the discount rule was used.

members.name: original
members.doc: Original discount rule name (in site's default language).

members.name: translated
members.doc:
Translated discount rule name according to buyer language.

Default: `original`

members.name: rule
members.doc: Discount Rule

members.name: appliesTo
members.doc: Discount applies to either `ALL_ITEMS`, or to the `LOWEST_PRICED_ITEM`.

members.name: includeSubscription
members.doc:
Whether the discount will apply to subscriptions.

Default: `false`

members.name: usageLimit
members.doc: Maximum total number of uses allowed for the discount rule.

members.name: usageLimitPerUser
members.doc:
The usage limit per user per discount.
When not provided, this setting will not apply.

description: The discount settings

members.name: and
members.doc: Chain multiple triggers with the `and` operator.

members.name: customTrigger
members.doc: Custom trigger.

members.name: itemQuantityRange
members.doc: Item quantity trigger range.

members.name: or
members.doc: Chain multiple triggers with the `or` operator.

members.name: subtotalRange
members.doc: Subtotal trigger range.

members.name: triggerType
members.doc:
Trigger type.

+ `"AND"`: Operator used for chaining multiple triggers. Currently 1 `"AND"` chain operator is supported.
+ `"SUBTOTAL_RANGE"`: Subtotal must be within the specified `subtotalRange` values.
+ `"ITEM_QUANTITY_RANGE"`: Quantity of items in scope must be within specified `itemQuantityRange` values.
+ `"CUSTOM"`: Custom trigger type defined in `customTrigger` object.

description: DiscountTrigger - description of a set of conditions, that if met, will trigger the associated rule actions

members.name: and
members.doc: Chain multiple triggers with the `and` operator.

members.doc: Item quantity trigger range.

members.name: or

members.doc: Subtotal trigger range.

members.name: values
members.doc: Discounts.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging

members.name: type
members.doc: Scope type.

description:
This object represents a scope of catalog items. Examples:
1. All catalog items of a specific app - type = CATALOG_ITEM, CatalogItemFilter with `catalog_app_id`
2. Specific catalog item - type = CATALOG_ITEM, CatalogItemFilter with `catalog_app_id` + `catalog_item_ids`
3. External catalog filter - type = CUSTOM_FILTER, CustomFilter with 'app_id' + 'params'
